channel.title: Object Spawning (delta source 317)
channel.description: Ok, I have this awesome command called ::obj it visually put the object on screen(temperately) and also writes them to ./config/objects.txt any way I have done it this way for a while and I am starting to notice that as I change my height the objects follow is there a way to set an int for height level if that would be awesome let me know, Thanks.

item.title: Object Spawning (delta source 317)
item.dc:creator: @silabgarza silabgarza
item.description:
@silabgarza wrote:

heheh i had to do this when i was working on castlewars flags

public void makeGlobalObject2(int x, int y, int typeID, int orientation, int tileObjectType, int height){ //Makes Global objects for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players){ if(p != null){ client person = (client)p; if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null")){ if(person.distanceToPoint(x, y) <= 60){ if(person.heightLevel == height) { person.createNewTileObject(x, y, typeID, orientation, tileObjectType);}}}}}}

Read full topic

item.title: Object Spawning (delta source 317)
item.dc:creator: @FusionLord FusionLord
item.description:
@FusionLord wrote:

Ok, I have this awesome command called ::obj it visually put the object on screen(temperately) and also writes them to ./config/objects.txt any way I have done it this way for a while and I am starting to notice that as I change my height the objects follow is there a way to set an int for height level if that would be awesome let me know, Thanks.

Read full topic
